definition: cat burglar/burglar who gains entrance by scaling walls/intruding enemy airman/air marauder

sentences.english: Stick two small white or silver feathers into the Styrofoam ball to serve as the wings of the snitch.
sentences.chinese: 你的金色飛賊別忘了加上兩個銀色的翅膀。

sentences.english: Coolidge, knowing there was $ 80 in the billfold, persuaded the intruder to sit down and talk.
sentences.chinese: 柯立芝知道錢包裏有80美元，他勸飛賊坐下來談談。
我認爲你是我的金色飛賊。

sentences.english: Player whose objective is to spot and catch the Golden Snitch .
sentences.chinese: 以發現並捉住金色飛賊爲目標的球員。

sentences.english: He nearly dropped the Snitch in surprise and excitement.
sentences.chinese: 他激動和驚訝得差點把金色飛賊扔掉。

sentences.english: His eyes lingered for a moment on the giant Snitch cake.
sentences.chinese: 他的目光在那巨大的金色飛賊蛋糕上逗留了片刻。

sentences.english: The Seeker who catches the Snitch ends the game.
sentences.chinese: 捕球手一搶到金色飛賊，比賽就宣佈結束。

definition: to murder without blinking an eye (idiom)/ruthless/cold-blooded
the critical moment/life and death crisis
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
child bride/girl adopted into a family as future daughter-in-law
out of ammunition and no food left (idiom); in desperate straits
lit. killing the chicken to warn the monkey (idiom)/fig. to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
fate is unfavorable (idiom); the omens are not good
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
to heave a sigh of relief
to whisper to one another's ear
